data.title: MOST OF CAST CHOSEN FOR 'CHORUS LINE' FILM
data.text:
All but one of the 17 performers who will co-star as auditioning dancers in ''A Chorus Line: The Motion Picture'' were announced yesterday by the film version's director, Sir Richard Attenborough, and the choreographer, Jeffrey Hornaday.

Five were in ''A Chorus Line'' on Broadway or on tour: Pam Klinger, Justin Ross, Matt West, Vicki Frederick and Alyson Reed who will play the role of Cassie.

The others are: Blane Savage, Charles McGowan, Jan Gan, Michelle Johnston, Janet Jones, Gregg Burge, Tony Fields, Nicole Fosse, Michael Blevins, Cameron English and Yamil Borges. Still to be cast are the roles of Val, one of the dancers, and Zak, the director.

The film, by Embassy Pictures and Polygram Pictures, is being produced by Cy Feuer and Ernest Martin. The show's composer, Marvin Hamlisch, and lyricist, Edward Kleban, are revising the score. Arnold Schulman adapted the book. Principal filming is to start Oct. 1 at the Mark Hellinger Theater. Release is scheduled for Christmas 1985.
